tournament.name: Rencontres Legacy de Paris - Main Event

decks.notes: The deck focuses on using creatures that can be easily discarded to activate abilities, allowing for efficient aggression. Key cards like Survival of the Fittest and Vengevine help maintain board presence and pressure opponents. The deck also features strong disruption with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Wasteland to control the game. With a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly while also having answers for opposing threats. By utilizing a combination of creatures and spells, this deck aims to outpace opponents and secure victory.

The main focus of this control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through targeted discard spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate, and land destruction with cards like Wasteland. The deck also utilizes efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary to apply pressure and control the board. The inclusion of cards like Dark Confidant and Sensei's Divining Top provide card advantage and consistency. The deck aims to control the game through disruption and efficient threats until it can secure a win condition.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize artifacts to lock down the opponent's board and slowly grind them out of resources. This is done through cards like Smokestack, Chalice of the Void, and Trinisphere to disrupt their gameplay. The deck also aims to control the game with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Propaganda to protect itself while setting up its prison strategy. The inclusion of cards like Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland also allows for resource denial and helps to keep the opponent on the back foot.

This deck focuses on aggressive Merfolk creatures that can quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap counterspells and disruptive creatures. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and a mix of disruptive creatures like Cursecatcher and Lord of Atlantis, the deck aims to control the game while still applying pressure. With additional protection from counterspells and the ability to bounce problematic permanents with Echoing Truth, the deck aims to maintain board control and tempo advantage to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively use Survival of the Fittest to tutor for key creatures like Vengevine and Loyal Retainers, while using aggressive creatures like Basking Rootwalla and Noble Hierarch to apply pressure early on. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to control the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes a graveyard strategy with cards like Wonder and Iona, Shield of Emeria. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands.

The deck is focused on disrupting the opponent's game plan while controlling the board with cards like Standstill, Humility, and Engineered Explosives. It uses powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Elspeth, Knight-Errant to generate card advantage and win conditions. The deck also includes a suite of counterspells and removal spells to handle threats efficiently. Mishra's Factory provides a resilient threat and Mishra's card advantage and card selection provided by Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top help to ensure the control player has answers to the opponent's threats.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Wild Mongrel and Basking Rootwalla, enabling the player to cheat Vengevine into play. Survival of the Fittest is a key card that allows for creature tutoring and graveyard manipulation. The deck aims to be aggressive and efficient, using cards like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to accelerate mana production. Control elements like Brainstorm, Daze, and Force of Will help protect the game plan and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on a fast and efficient way to bring powerful creatures onto the battlefield by utilizing cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Show and Tell. Players aim to quickly discard a big creature into the graveyard, then reanimate it onto the battlefield to overwhelm their opponent. With a mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, as well as protection with Daze and Brainstorm, the deck aims to control the game while deploying massive threats like Sphinx of the Steel Wind and Iona, Shield of Emeria.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize fast mana generation and card selection in order to ramp up quickly and storm off with powerful spells like Ad Nauseam, Tendrils of Agony, and Empty the Warrens. The deck aims to generate a critical mass of spells in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in one explosive turn. The use of cards like Burning Wish allows for flexibility and versatility in accessing key combo pieces from the sideboard, while disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress help protect the combo from opponent's interference.

The key concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana and chain together spells in order to create a storm count, which then allows the player to cast powerful cards and win the game in a single turn. This is achieved through cards like Dark Ritual, Rite of Flame, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana, while cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish allow the player to search for and cast key cards like Ad Nauseam, Tendrils of Agony, and Empty the Warrens. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress and Orim's Chant to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient low-cost burn spells and creatures. The deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero by utilizing cards like Goblin Guide, Lightning Bolt, and Lava Spike. The inclusion of cards like Grim Lavamancer and Steppe Lynx provide additional ways to pressure the opponent. Price of Progress acts as a powerful finisher, while Path to Exile offers removal for any problematic creatures. The mana base consists of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency and speed.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Survival of the Fittest, Vengevine, and Wild Mongrel to quickly fill up the graveyard and bring back powerful creatures. The deck aims to be aggressive and use its creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and counter spells. It relies on synergy between its creatures and spells to create a powerful and fast-paced strategy that can take the opponent by surprise.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Stoneforge Mystic to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Aven Mindcensor. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice enhances the deck's ability to close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck utilizes versatile cards like Mother of Runes and Qasali Pridemage to protect its threats and interact with the opponent's board. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also providing utility with lands like Karakas and Horizon Canopy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and disrupting opponents' strategies. Utilizing cards like Force of Will, Daze, Counterbalance, and Sensei's Divining Top, the deck aims to prevent threats from resolving while also having the ability to manipulate the top of the deck with Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Additionally, the deck includes versatile creatures like Rhox War Monk and Tarmogoyf, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by efficiently controlling the game state and slowly building up advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures like Vengevine and Basking Rootwalla using cards like Survival of the Fittest and Wild Mongrel. It then aims to bring those creatures back onto the battlefield as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Spell Pierce and Daze to protect its game plan. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent to win the game.

This deck aims to control the game by using various removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures such as Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary. It also utilizes cards like Dark Confidant and Sensei's Divining Top for card advantage and manipulation. The mana base is designed to support the deck's diverse color requirements, with fetch lands and dual lands ensuring consistent access to the necessary colors. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan while generating incremental value to eventually overpower them.
